name: LocationFinder
short_description: Its an android app which accepts a point of interest (e.g. food) and a radius from a user. Then, it identifies user's current location by using GPS on the device. Based on the current location, radius and point of interest it queries Google Places and populate the result which could be all the places related to the given point of interest on the Google Map. User can see his/her current location and all the places near him. Each place is identified with an icon indicating type of the place. Point of interest could be very broad. In our case, "food" could encompass restaurant, confectionery and etc.
summary: An android app capable of pinpointing points of interests in a radius
